Notes.Text:
This update to Firefox 31.7.0 ESR (bsc#930622) fixes the following issues:

  * MFSA 2015-46/CVE-2015-2708/CVE-2015-2709
    (bmo#1120655, bmo#1143299, bmo#1151139, bmo#1152177,
     bmo#1111251, bmo#1117977, bmo#1128064, bmo#1135066,
     bmo#1143194, bmo#1146101, bmo#1149526, bmo#1153688,
     bmo#1155474)
    Miscellaneous memory safety hazards (rv:38.0 / rv:31.7)
  * MFSA 2015-47/CVE-2015-0797
    (bmo#1080995)
    Buffer overflow parsing H.264 video with Linux Gstreamer
  * MFSA 2015-48/CVE-2015-2710
    (bmo#1149542)
    Buffer overflow with SVG content and CSS
  * MFSA 2015-51/CVE-2015-2713
    (bmo#1153478)
    Use-after-free during text processing with vertical text
    enabled
  * MFSA 2015-54/CVE-2015-2716
    (bmo#1140537)
    Buffer overflow when parsing compressed XML
Notes.Title: Details

Relationships.RelatesToProductReference: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12

Vulnerabilities.Description: GStreamer before 1.4.5, as used in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.7, and Thunderbird before 31.7 on Linux, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (buffer over-read and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via crafted H.264 video data in an m4v file.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-translations-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:MozillaFirefox-devel-31.7.0esr-34.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.7, and Thunderbird before 31.7 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-translations-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:MozillaFirefox-devel-31.7.0esr-34.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in the browser engine in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0 allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code via unknown vectors.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-translations-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:MozillaFirefox-devel-31.7.0esr-34.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Heap-based buffer overflow in the SVGTextFrame class in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.7, and Thunderbird before 31.7 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via crafted SVG graphics data in conjunction with a crafted Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequence.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-translations-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:MozillaFirefox-devel-31.7.0esr-34.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Use-after-free vulnerability in the SetBreaks function in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.7, and Thunderbird before 31.7 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via a document containing crafted text in conjunction with a Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) token sequence containing properties related to vertical text.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-translations-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:MozillaFirefox-devel-31.7.0esr-34.1

Vulnerabilities.Description: Buffer overflow in the XML parser in Mozilla Firefox before 38.0, Firefox ESR 31.x before 31.7, and Thunderbird before 31.7 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code by providing a large amount of compressed XML data, a related issue to CVE-2015-1283.

ProductID: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Server for SAP Applications 12:MozillaFirefox-translations-31.7.0esr-34.1
SUSE Linux Enterprise Software Development Kit 12:MozillaFirefox-devel-31.7.0esr-34.1
